html:
Etymology 1[edit]

From ad- +‎ legō (“read, choose”).

Alternative forms[edit]

  • adlegō

Pronunciation[edit]

  • (Classical) IPA(key): /ˈal.le.ɡoː/, [ˈal.lʲɛ.ɡoː]
  • (Ecclesiastical) IPA(key): /ˈal.le.ɡo/, [ˈal.lɛ.ɡɔ]

Verb[edit]

allegō (present infinitive allegere, perfect active allēgī, supine allēctum); third conjugation

  1. I select, choose, recruit, elect or admit (to or into something)
Conjugation[edit]

Derived terms[edit]
  • allectīvus (Mediaeval)
  • allēctor
  • allēctūra
  • allēctus
Related terms[edit]
  • colligō
  • dīligō
  • ēligō
  • intellegō
  • legō
  • neglegō
  • perlegō
  • praelegō
  • relegō
  • sēligō
  • sublegō
 
Descendants[edit]
  • Aromanian: aleg, aleadziri
  • English: adlect
  • Romanian: alege, alegere

Etymology 2[edit]

From ad- +‎ lēgō (“despatch”).

Alternative forms[edit]

  • adlēgō

Pronunciation[edit]

  • (Classical) IPA(key): /alˈleː.ɡoː/, [alˈlʲeː.ɡoː]
  • (Ecclesiastical) IPA(key): /alˈle.ɡo/, [alˈlɛː.ɡɔ]

Verb[edit]

allēgō (present infinitive allēgāre, perfect active allēgāvī, supine allēgātum); first conjugation

  1. I send someone away with a commission or charge, despatch, depute, employ, commission
  2. I instigate someone to an act of fraud or deceit
  3. I bring forward, relate, recount, mention, adduce; urge, plead
